SEARCH
Module uk.ac.soton.comp1206
Package uk.ac.soton.comp1206.game

Class Game

java.lang.Object
uk.ac.soton.comp1206.game.Game
Direct Known Subclasses:
MultiplayerGame
public class Game extends Object
The Game class handles the main logic, state and properties of the TetrECS game. Methods to manipulate the game state and to handle actions made by the player should take place inside this class.

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game(int cols, int rows)
      Create a new game with the specified rows and columns. Creates a corresponding grid model.
      Parameters:
      cols - number of columns
      rows - number of rows

    • Game

      public Game(int cols, int rows, Communicator comm)
      Create a new game with the specified rows and columns and a communicator. Creates a corresponding grid model.
      Parameters:
      cols - number of columns
      rows - number of rows
      comm - communicator for the multiplayer game

      public void nextPiece()
      Replaces the current piece with a new piece

    • afterPiece

      public void afterPiece()
      Called after a piece is played Iterates over rows and columns and stores the number of lines to be cleared and the blocks that need to be cleared Updates score and multiplier Clears blocks

    • clearBlocks

      public void clearBlocks(HashSet<GameBlockCoordinate> blocksToClear)
      Sets the value of the blocks at the given coordinates to 0 ("clearing them") Called in afterPiece()
      Parameters:
      blocksToClear - HashSet containing GameBlockCoordinate of the blocks that need to be cleared

    • score

      public void score(int linesToClear, int blocksToClear)
      Updates the score after each piece is played Called in updateScoreAndMultiplier()
      Parameters:
      linesToClear - number of lines cleared after playing a piece
      blocksToClear - number of blocks cleared after playing a piece

    • updateLevel

      public void updateLevel()
      Update the level when the score changes

    • rotateCurrentPiece

      public void rotateCurrentPiece(boolean left)
      Rotates the current piece If piece needs to be rotated left, perform a 90-degree rotation 3 times
      Parameters:
      left - = true if the piece needs to be rotated left

    • swapCurrentPiece

      public void swapCurrentPiece()
      Swaps the current piece and incoming piece Called if user wants to play the originally incoming piece before current piece

    • reduceLives

      public void reduceLives()
      Reduce the number of lives by 1

      public void setTimerDelay()
      Updates timerDelay

    • getTimerDelay

      public javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty getTimerDelay()
      Accessor method for timerDelay
      Returns:
      timerDelay

    • gameLoop

      public void gameLoop()
      Handles what must be done when the timer reaches 0 Lose a life, current piece is discarded, multiplier is reset to 1 and timer is reset

    • startTimer

      public void startTimer()
      Starts the timer and calls gameLoop method when the timer runs out

    • restartTimer

      public void restartTimer()
      Stops and purges the timer before starting it again

    • stopTimer

      public void stopTimer()
      Stops timer

    • skipPiece

      public void skipPiece()
      Allows you to skip piece, but you lose a life point is you don’t have to wait for timer to end if you know you can't play that piece or don't want to play that piece
